content: Lifestyle Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 09 Apr 2019What are the best ways to earn some side income as a university student? Want to earn at least 15 an hour part time3 answersAnswerBump0

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardUpdated on 10 Apr 2019Private tuition - definitely more than $15 an hourWork out instructor - if you are able to (and also qualified), teaching group classes would pay more than $15 an hour. I think this spans anything from yoga to HIIT to zumbaDog walking - apparently it pays anywhere from $13-25 per walkOn a same thread - pet sitting. Said to pay $15 an hourIf you are skilled in video editting/photoshop/graphic design - take up projects on the sideLikewise for writing good copy0 comments3

Clarence Chua, Financial Planning Specialist at Prudential Assurance SingaporeTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 09 Apr 2019There are various ways to earn 15/H. 
It will be best if you like the work you are doing too.Do you have any specific set of skills? Such as copyrighting,lifesaving for events, photography, etc. These skills will be able to give 15/H.Alternatively you can be a private tutor tutoring Secondary school kids or even list your skills on fiverr.0 comments3
